title: Beginner's Guide to Thermodynamics
headline: This free online course is a beginner's guide to thermodynamics, which describes the ways of measuring energy.
description: Thermodynamics studies the links between heat, work, temperature and energy. This course goes into detail concerning all the concepts and terminology of thermodynamics. We will explore energy, its various forms and the formulas used to measure it. How can you use the mechanism of energy transfer? What is an exothermic reaction? This course delves into these explanations, including the study of internal energy. Enrol today!

courseDescription:
This course is a beginner's guide to thermodynamics and presents accurate information on concepts and terminology. It explains and defines state and path functions, guiding you through specific details on the various forms of energy. You will be able to answer questions such as: What formulas measure energy? What are the forms of energy media or mechanisms of energy transfer? This course discusses these definitions of ‘net energy transfer’ and forms of energy media. 

Next, we will teach you about enthalpy, its chemical reactions and the distinct varieties of applying the exothermic reaction in the work environment. Then we will compare an exothermic reaction to an endothermic reaction and discover how to employ internal energy properly. Finally, the course will end by describing internal energy at constant volume.

This course will provide you with a better understanding of the study of thermodynamics, giving you clear and precise methods to measure energy. Have you considered expanding your knowledge of the study of thermodynamics? This course is excellent for those in the scientific field and people who would like to familiarise themselves with this fascinating field. We encourage you to expand your knowledge by commencing this free course today.
